Description: Attic red-figured pottery squat lekythos; flaring mouth and wide rim, single handle, narrow neck, globular body, and ring base; red-figure decoration consisting of reserved palmette on body opposite handle; below, around base, traces of an added red band; some chipping on body.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by McLean Museum and Art Gallery, Greenock. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Even though the Greenock database suggests an excavation year of 1885, this is not based on information in the register which gives no details. Given the shape and state of preservation, it seems likely that the vase was found in the cemetery of Naukratis during the second season of excavation. For parallels regarding shape (though with a narrower rim) and decoration, see Reading 48.12.12.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0817) (Phase 1)
